Detailed Description

Set of pixels that defines a pattern to be recognized as a character in classification stage.

A pattern is a matrix of binary pixels that represents a character found in the preprocessing stage. Thus, it is composed of ink pixels, and a number of background pixels to fill the holes in the matrix that do not belong to the character. Every pattern has a fixed size, since a pre-requisite for an optimal classification is that patterns must be normalized to constant width and height.

Author:

void Pattern::writeToOutputImage ( const std::string &  outputFile,
const bool &  invert = false 
) const

Create a new image in the filesystem using Magick++ with the pattern drawn.

Parameters:
outputFile A string with the image name in the filesystem.
invert A boolean value that decides whether to invert the pixel values or not.
Postcondition:
A new image file is created in the filesystem. The image type is assigned according to the file extension provided in the filename (e.g. "foo.png" selects PNG as the image type). Otherwise the image type is Magick++'s implementation-dependent.
